pageProps.content:
Experience

Ndali Lodge is perched on the edge of an extinct volcano, which over centuries has been filled with water to become the vast Lake Nyinambuga in the Bunyaruguru Crater Field in Uganda.
This rustic & intimate lodge prides itself on its relaxed & friendly atmosphere, ensuring that its guests feel right at home throughout their stay. The staff are locals who come from nearby villages & have been professionally trained to ensure excellent service.

Stay

Ndali Lodge has 8 individual cottages, all of which offer spectacular views of the Rwenzori
Mountains & Queen Elizabeth National Park.
The solar-energy cottages are built of local stone & thatch & therefore blend in with the natural environment. Each cottage is large enough to accommodate a family & is equipped with an en-suite bathroom & private veranda.
There is also a honeymoon cottage that is slightly larger & comes complete with bathtub & shower.
The lodge’s communal area includes a lounge, dining room & swimming pool with endless views of the beautiful lake.

Activities

Ndali provides local guides for guided walks around the thousand-acre farm & to the Mahoma
Waterfall, with the opportunity to spot primates, birds & butterflies along the way. Guests can also go on exciting kayak excursions on the lake.

subfolders.title: Papaya Lake Lodge
subfolders.description: The intimate & peaceful Papaya Lake Lodge is located close to Kibale National Park & Queen Elizabeth Park, where exhilarating chimpanzee treks & sights of the red colobus monkey can be enjoyed. Papaya Lake Lodge offers sweeping views of Lyantonde & Kifuruka Lakes within Uganda’s Great Crater Lakes region.

subfolders.title: Turaco Treetops Lodge
subfolders.description: Turaco Treetops Lodge is a luxury lodge set in the lush rainforest neighbouring Uganda’s Kibale National Park.   With uninterrupted views over the snow-capped Rwenzori Mountains & Kibale Forest, Turaco Treetops Lodge is the ideal place to immerse yourself in nature & experience an Uganda safari of note.
